atec-Fg2F5QIPHG0C8Fthg.text: Some may wonder why i give this place the full five star treatment.  Well, whilst it might not look as fancy as some glorified pizza places that plague our city, this tiny, friendly place serves some of the best pizza and pasta in Soho.Now I usually refuse to order pasta anywhere as you can always make it at home for next to nothing, but the 3 cheese pasta here is really tasty.  Do what i do on my fat days and order a portion as a sharing dish alongside one of the many great pizza's.  The really great thing is that the prices here are so good it's still cheaper and better than any of the commercial places nearby.Good for small groups as well!

photos.caption: Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom. La Porchetta

djgDA5kwi7-Et52QzSxUhw.text: Initially taken here by an old work colleague (old as in no longer working together, not aged - although have taken the parentals here too and they loved it) as he knew the owner. Turns out he only knew the owner as he had been a regular there for years. Must be good, I thought and BOY.. couldn't have been more right! I love this place. The food is literally made in front of your eyes in an open kitchen by the chef who mumbles to himself / sings to himself. Real italian food cooked in the big fire ovens, served by crazy Italian family at a superb price of around £7 for a main. And HUGE. As in the titanic of pizzas. And smothered in a real home made fresh Italian tomato sauce. Also offer amazing chilli oil to spice it all up a bit too. AND if you're lucky, and the owner is in a particularly friendly mood... free limoncello at the end of the meal! The outside seating / window tables also offer the best view of the London Street Television and the classic mixture of Soho characters. Could the London Italian life get any better?

eQmP__jKpsoYghJWp1kqfw.text: Simply one of the best places in London where taste the proper italian pizza!! The restaurant is always busy and happens you have to wait a bit even if you have a table but is worth it!! Italian staff and of course italian pizzaioli!!!

eh9d_yiAcpIPyoj8nabx1A.text: Came here on recommendation from yelp and it did not disappoint. Had stuffed mushrooms, italian sausage with polenta and ricotta/tomato pasta. Dishes were great and very reasonably priced. Italian staff had some difficulty understanding orders but very friendly.Would recommend this to everyone looking for hearty italian fare that won't break the budget.

CZqdDutvYuMnfi5Fit9qYg.text: Great value.  We're moderate eaters and split a pizza with plenty to eat.  The house wine was credible.  Pizzas run 6-8 pounds.  The house wine is 17 pounds a 750 ml bottle.  The staff is professional and friendly.  The table of eight next to us all got their meals at the same time.  The calzone and pasta dishes looked great and the servings were huge.  A nice, local restaurant worth a visit.

1kgMy9Fj9xBxvYVI_8zsbQ.text: Quite good and quite cheap, I was brought here with some friends after an event in Soho and was told it was a legit Italian place (as exampled by the workers shouting not in english and looking angrily at each other, like any normal Italian family might)It was pretty busy at night, but I don't think we had to wait much longer than 15 min or so for a table.  They seemed to run like a well-oiled machine, and the pizzas were fresh and fast. Certainly worth a stop, there's a few good choices for cheap eats in this little radius, so give them a shot and re-appreciate soho for something other than 15 pound cocktails.

2dscq6ru0rUBk_NfqrbUiA.text: This is my favourite italian restaurant in London!!!It has a proper italian canteen feel to it, portions are quite generous, food is extra fresh, the menu is huge and the best thing is that the prices are very reasonable. I go at least once a week. Its a must if you are in soho.

-tmVKxDr-Ur7f2Oof24KyA.text: I have been here a few times.It is a great place to eat. The portions are huge and really inexpensive. Perfect after a long day of sight seeing or a long evening of drinking.Any of the pizzas are really good, though I would pass on the calamari.

zcwTfnmuqBgGqkf994xXbQ.text: Excellent, authentic Italian food for a reasonable price.  Only complaint was the service, but this is fairly standard based on my experiences in London.  Otherwise, the food was delicious.  Would definitely go back next time in London.  Great sized portions as well.

a-FRNwFtGmwQ1O_YeHUXAw.text: One of the best Italian restaurants I know in London: great food, nice service, good prices. I love their Gnocchi Gorgonzola. Also the pizza is great. They make the pizza in a big oven. You can see how they make it. Their service is always friendly. The restaurant is wheelchair accessible. Their disabled toilet is small but they have one.

1D-0KAVAJ7TbMBBuQxop3Q.text: Bad service and poor food! The food took forever to arrive, we had to grab the managers attention and waitress was no where to be found. The waitress had a bad attitude she was only diligent when she had to give us the bill. The food was not all that great either lacked authentic Italian flavors. I do not recommend this place if you are looking for great Italian dishes.  They only attract customers with their low prices but everything else is very poor.

wDWohNKBy9j1m2fb_ldI7g.text: Almost didn't  experience the food at all, having been ignored by all and sundry for ages after sitting down - had to ask for a menu. Almost got up and left but decided to persevere mainly because of great reviews I read. Wish I'd got up and left now. Ordered bruschetta followed by spaghetti vongole thinking bruschetta would be nice fresh starter before main.  Unfortunately bruschetta was far too salty and far too oily and came with limp salad which I left. Not nice. Fingers crossed for the main, which turned out to be better although I had to fish out a dozen thick slices of garlic, which may have been to some tastes but not mine.  Look, I'm no expert, but this is basic fare, not much more. I would expect any half decent restaurant to serve up food better than I could make, but I can honestly say that I could do better. Wish I'd had pizza, which looked good. I live in Sale, a small town south of Manchester and we have at least 4 Italian restaurants that are better than this. This place is OK but not great. Also, and this isn't Porchetta's fault, I had to endure a shrieking imbecile sat near me for the duration of my meal.  All in all not the best dining experience I've ever had. Having said all that, just got the bill and it was very cheap.

GIXX7Z-Of1ykCFxJqJW9wQ.text: After several so-so meals in the Soho area, a local friend took me to La Porchetta.  Quick, inexpensive and tasty--it wasn't fine dining, but it was definitely good food for a good value.

J7NaWBSnxAgtYLfGWgjPKw.text: I went in this italian restaurant for the first time this lunch with some Brazilian friend and as Italian girl I can absolutely say that is very very good.The prices are so cheap respect the big portion and the tasty is delicious.Believe me I think that is impossible find another place in the heart of London where eat very good Italian food and cheap .I want advice you pizza and gnocchi gorgonzola you must try it.The place is rustic and homely you have to go there .

6vwTrrOMKEX3QKwDamS_7A.text: Yum!  The pizza here is amazingly good and not expensive.

7efLX19iEg8vE0uVA4kBEg.text: Most would be attracted by the price; but food was generally on the poor side. Staff were friendly and very attentive given how busy it was on the December Thursday evening. Varied menu. Quite oily food. Pizzas not as good as Pizza Express or Zizi, but they are cheaper by a couple of pounds. (Best pizza in London is possibly Pizza East in either Shoreditch, Portobello Road or Kentish Town). Bottled beer was served ice cold. Chairs had no lumber support. No atmosphere, very very brightly lit and low-rent feel to fixtures, fittings and decoration. Tables were low, cramped, with an unusual, giant base meaning there was nowhere for taller people (e.g. 6 foot) to put their feet and knees. Bill for starter, main (pizza) and two drinks each was £19 per person including 10% service charge. Personally, I'd rather spend a little more and have a more comfortable, tasty experience.  I'll not be returning.

0scuC36vG8VdnuWq4m3EFQ.text: This independent restaurant is an absolute triumph for the Soho food scene. Having occupied the same spot for more years than most of us would care to remember, La Porchetta has been serving up great dish after great dish to thousands of enthusiastic regulars.The quality of the food is not gourmet, but at these prices you really can't grumble. The portions are extremely generous and it's rare for me to finish all the food I'm faced with. The service is friendly and even at the busiest period, you never feel rushed or pressured to leave.La Porchetta is highly recommended.

a3XPwpBtgPGKnaGv9unJaw.text: Great food at amazing prices. Have been coming here since 1987. There have been a few changes along the way. It used to have bench seating and they would mix strangers. It was a great way to meet people and I never felt weird dining alone - bring back the bench seating. Usually go for the Gnocci Quatro Formaggi but have tried several dishes - all good. Have a carafe of the house wine. And don't miss the Panna Cotta for desert. You'll be stunned at how cheap it can be to dine in the centre of London if you know where to go.

A_63hDEEQgj7_UNkHGGXuA.text: No frills, cafe style Italian. Menu is so reasonable you'll wonder the quality of what you're going to get. But don't be fooled. The food here is very good. One of my favourites in Soho. Not only are the pasta dishes good, but try the mussels - it's on the starter side, but the portion is huge - this will some bread is enough for lunch and really tasty.

MRFDD8aIdtCkakCE3jRYZg.text: Affordable pasta in a great location. The decor is nothing too flash but the pasta and pizza is really delicious, and the servings are quite large.

suOGfgqL99WJkihbsoe3SQ.text: Incredible food for surprisingly reasonable price! With an abundance of deliciously simply destined options, my friend and I finally settled on pizza (as it looked and smelled too good to pass up) and red table wine (as the bottle price- just under 15 pounds- was too good to pass up!). While we waited for our pizza, we sipped our wine (nothing spectacular, but very satisfying and comfortable) while enjoying the busy, familial atmosphere of the restaurant. Though distracted and hard-worked, the staff was very polite and brought water quickly when we managed to get their attention between running plates of pasta and pizza to their happy, hungry clientele. When our pies were brought out, they did not disappoint; I myself happily tucked into a broccoli and sausage pizza, which managed to balance the toppings, sauce, and cheese impeccably. My friend thoroughly enjoyed her mushroom pizza. The crust, a crunchy woodfired style, was a sturdy and delicious vehicle for fresh ingredients. A friendly, well-run, fairly-priced, and (most importantly!) tasty establishment, I highly recommend :)

nw4vfFwODKbiu2NvYZd8tQ.text: I am not sure what everyone sees in this place. The food was decent, but nothing memorable.The best thing about this place was the prices. Pretty much all dishes are under £10. My girlfriend and I split a pizza (hawaiian) and a pasta dish (spaghetti bolognese). We also ordered a half bottle of wine. Our total bill came to around £30. Do a bit more research and I am sure you will come across better Italian.

PEpJnTfv6OmeWSz12_Q4wQ.text: I've tried quite a few of the Italian restaurants along Old Compton Street. I haven't had a bad experience yet, however, this particular restaurant seems to offer the same menu, the same level of good service except at an astonishingly good price.I had a pasta dish and my wife had a pizza. Both were excellent. My two young children shared a meal as they are quite large portions. The nest time I'm in the area I'll defiantly eat here again.

w7oeal9vUlwhshdNZS7tzA.text: If I could, I would give 4,5 stars. This place was absolutely lovely. The food was great, we had starters, pizzas and garlic pizza. The garlic pizza was amazing, it tasted like real garlic and was the size of a pizza. It looks a bit shoddy from the outside, but you shouldn't hesitate to go in! The price was great, customer service was great, everything was great. Recommending for everyone!

50401k3zHmpWofxopPxP7Q.text: I'm a big fan of this place. Pretty much all the meals I've had from here have been great. The menu is huge and I can never decide what to have. It's not a fancy place but has a pretty authentic Italian feel.The pizza is thin and crispy, which is exactly what I like. There can be some issues with timing (burnt bits) if the less experienced pizza chef is on and they're busy! Also, when getting take away just check that you have been given the right thing, one time I got given the wrong pasta dish.Overall this is a good place, and prices are better than chain pizza and Italian restaurant, and good for London.

NDDugo8iqLKTlzSuM7BEQQ.text: Went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews.  Lucky to get a seat at the window on a Saturday night-first problem of the meal; the staff sat outside the window smoking.The food; my daughter had the Risotto.  I know Risotto to be a creamy dish.  sorry to say it was undercooked, its flavor was fine, its texture was not.  I had a pasta sausage dish, overall the flavor was OK, however, the sausage was burnt, no not overcooked, burnt.  The Pizza looked great, didn't have any, just our seat had use close to the oven and we could see the pies.

VcMIWFOKStaGA7hpkmpIvg.text: Wish we had a better experience as the prior reviews really set us up for a great time. To keep it short, prices for central London are great but the service is horrible. You truly get what you pay for!

URlCUcWgrcE4X46-lXVqpQ.text: So I realize London can be expensive. But the last few meals I had were not that good and pretty pricey. So I turned to yelp for help. Good thing. I asked for affordable meal near the British Museum and La Porchatta was recommended. I had 2 glasses of wine and a delicious tomato/onion salad and a pizza for £15. And it was authentic Italian pizza. Great place, will return next time in London Town. Grazie and ciao

MVHLRXWl5SpnTdOu8A0VvQ.text: The food is fantastic, very large portions.  The house red was quite nice too.  Excellent value for your meal.  Service was not so great though, we needed refills on drinks which never happened and other drink order was also completely forgotten and still showed up on the bill.  Otherwise it was a very nice meal and would recommend.

J4X0VUk4X5T66tEKU7WQaA.text: Pizza Etna was incredible. Great prices as well. Will be back for sure. Authentic Italian food. One of the best places I've eaten in London.

FCIu4rbJ6wCakLplj3efRA.text: So yummy! The food is really hearty and feels like your local friendly Italian. Although I have never tried the pizzas they do look and smell amazing. But I can strongly vouch for the Penne a la Vodka - it's perfect and this is one of the only spots in London that makes it properly. The service leaves a little something to be desired, but at the price you really can't expect great service... especially in London.

AMp0nW-hcEoA1V_mkRhB3Q.text: I won't give this place a second look.. But the massive plate of pasta did. Oh and the pizza dude working his magic on a ball of dough.. Yupp I like a front row seat! Home made fresh pasta. Sold! Big juicy prawns and muscles. Sold! (I had the marinara btw). And who needs pizza express when you can get pizza from this joint. Mama Mia! Portions are big and it's tasty too. It's faff free food and so are the prices. Staff are friendly and very Italiano. Won't be long till I go back there and say Ciao Bella! ( corny but cool!!!)

MJk8dXahmnFbD1YwlYuVmA.text: The outside of the building doesn't look like much - but it's definitely worth going in! A nice italian restaurant with ridiculously affordable prices for the location. A glass of wine is about £2.50 and pizza and calzones (which are quite large portions) range from £6-7.50! The food is good and I enjoy going here for the occasional lunch or dinner. My husband has an insane metabolism and a huge appetite so this is perfect for us. So far I've tried the tortelloni and the penne gorgonzola. Both were good - but next time I want to try the calzone. My husband had it last time and it was delicious. Service is a little slow - but as an American in Britain, I find the service overall to be held to a higher standard in the US so perhaps that's where my bias comes from. In any case, check them out!

S0CZjjPZhzl14JZkH5vQ7g.text: Its a miss this time! This one is passable.The reviews I read on Yelp did not connect with the experience we had at La Porchetta. I ordered a calzone which was portioned quite large but disappointingly average. The dough was tasteless while the stuffing was mediocre. My husband on the other had the calamari with tomato sauce on a bread. I tasted his food and it was a bit on a spicy side while the sauce lack the flavour. Also, the squid was not so fresh and the the bread was questionable as it became so soggy from the sauce.  After consuming my food, I was thinking of giving this place 2 stars for the friendly staff and service they provided. However, my husband noticed that the guy making the dough for pizzas and calzones walked in from the outside of the restaurant, returned back to his work station (which happens to be next to our seat) but did not wash his hands! EEkkkkkkkk!!! Perhaps it is not such a good idea to have food preparers/chefs prepare and or entertain the clients at the same time.Overall, I certainly had a much better Italian food elsewhere for even lesser price but good quality.

vDLdYn3vM5KA_kTrI-mqaA.text: I was fooled by their name, which is not to be confused with the Porcetta chain that you can find in other areas nearby.. they seem to be a family run business, or at least, an all Italian crew.  Not too many frills, but the cook can be seen at the window chucking and spinning the dough into the air, and the service was fast and fairly friendly in that 'whacha wanta?' kind of way.The pizzas here are really good.. clean tasting, crispy thin crust that you can happily hold onto as you snarf it down.For the price, it's hard to do better for pizza in the area.  Five stars might be a tad high, considering the slightly downscale decor, but then I was kind to Soho' Joe's, and this pie is better than theirs, and even if it's just slightly lagging behind Rosso Pomodoro,  it's also almost half the price.

AkOv161vA6aKNjHLj4lSCA.text: Amazing food. You won't find better Italian for this price. The serves are big and the guy making the pizza knows his stuff - it's fun just to watch the pastry twirling.The waitresses had trouble understanding my Australian accent and were a bit confused by my drink order of a scotch and coke (they put a lemon wedge in the glass), but that didn't matter once the food came out.

TizAbNsgOyAvgpRD2P3PLg.text: MY FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT IN LONDON. Proper, fresh Italian food - and SO CHEAP!!Huge portions, and they even do takeaway!!!YOU WILL NOT REGRET EATING HERE!!!I would recommend Penne Arrabiatta, with Buffalo Mozzarella about £6.50 for a HUGE dish!

9o1JwcaFTIXE756i4BS6Qw.text: All I can say is - this is true good italian from the old country. We all had pastas and I had the eggplant parmesan - which is my favorite meal and we were not disappointed in the least. Service was good, except the waitress didn't speak very good English - adding to the "old country" feel. We sat downstairs so we didn't get to see the pizzas get made.

M2haio6Kpf7qzUZQVqxzKA.text: Cheap and tasty pizzas are cooked in the open kitchen at the front of the restaurant. Nice to watch it being made for you :)Base: 6/10. Not chewy, but not nearly thin nor crispy enoughFlavour: 7/10. Quattro Formaggi. A little heavy on the blue, but otherwise good.Portion: 10/10. Lots of cheese. Nice big 10 or 12 inch base. Price: 9/10. £6!Service: 8/10. Quick, to the point.

MMMh4KfUcQ_N39Z226RSNg.text: Favorite Italian restaurant in London! Huge portion sizes for very cheap! The restaurant is run by Italians so it is very authentic. The servers are very attentive and the food comes out quickly. It's also a great place for people with different dietary restrictions. We went back to la porchetta multiple times through out our time in London and had a great experience each time!

yBtRVubKH1_K9Qic98CbIw.text: Small restaurant next to Martin's theater. It is low key and has basic decor. The waitress was friendly and I enjoyed the margarita pizza

QCXsUvhcg7M2NQK47hfLmw.text: One action drastically changed this establishment's score all the way down to a one. Food was good. My wife and her sister weren't able to finish their pastas so they had asked for a box. I guess the restaurant packs it up for you because the waitress took their plates to put everything in a take away box. Unfortunately, as the waitress walked away the from table, I noticed one the forks falls from the plate to the ground. Some guy with a man bun behind the register picks it up and puts it back on the plate. I see the waitress mouth something to him and he makes a face and they both laugh at one another. I was giving them the benefit of the doubt, to own up on the situation, but nope, the waitress came back with the take away boxes. No "sorry we had a mishap and can't give you the take away box" ...nothing. Let's just pack contaminated food and give it back to the customer.  Could've been a one time thing but who knows??? If that's how they handle those types of situations, then maybe they're relaxed on how they handle their food to begin with. Major turnoff!

maWqvQp6FtISMMSn4Ovjhg.text: La Porchetta.. La Porchetta... How you have served me well this year.With the traditional homely feel of a family run Italian, La Porchetta never disappoints. Just like a 'Lidl' advert you are surprised by how cheap the bill is in regards to how great the food tasted and you will definitely come back for more!! I love Italian, and on a night out I love to save some pennies. This place hasn't marked all of it's prices up just cause it is in the heart of Soho, London. Neither has it scrimped on it's ingredients. If I am being completely honest I started going here as it was a cheap way to line my stomach before a night out (come on we can all admit we have done that), but now I come here cause the food is just so good. I always lean towards the pizza (Fiorentina.. I know, Egg on a pizza!!) and never get food envy. It's my go to place and my friends never complain.P.S GET THE £5 Aperol Spritz they are amazing!!

R6pm4vuVjOJaRDHXbnXkQw.text: This experience was a bit of a disaster for us. We went here because we were in the area, craving Italian food, and it was pretty well-rated. When we arrived, it looked like a cute, homey restaurant. However, we were quickly ushered downstairs, which didn't have any of the charm of upstairs. It looked like a windowless cafe, very plain. The menu was huge, with all the staples you would expect from an Italian restaurant. It took us a long time to get the waitress's attention, and she was surly with us. Our food took at least an hour to arrive. During that time, we saw a table of about twelve young men get their pizzas every ten minutes or so. Some of them had finished eating before others had received their food. We also saw two women with a young girl tell the waitress that they had been waiting for their food for a long time, and that they had theater tickets to get to. A couple came in after us (and after the women with theater tickets), and received their food first, at which point the women gave up, told the waitress that the wait had been ridiculous, and left. At this, the waitresses rolled their eyes and chatted/gossiped with each other. The food left a lot to be desired. My pasta was alright, but my boyfriend's pizza was undercooked and raw in the middle. Overall, do yourself a favor and go to any of the other amazing restaurants London has to offer.

XxEqEKUlACdAlh0uh5qMjQ.text: I lived in Rome for 3 years and have trouble enjoying pasta or pizza from many places, maybe I am over critical or expect more than I should from places. The penne arrabbiata here is just like it is in Rome, seriously... the best pasta I have had outside Italy. I was shocked! We also tried the pizza, which was good, but not excellent & the caprese salad wasn't terribly authentic but the penne overshadowed everything and now I am a huge fan of this place. The location and interior of the cafe does not do the food justice. It reminds me of an American Italian diner that serves overcooked mushy pasta. Needless to say I'm glad this wasn't the case. The price is also spot on and the service was quick and friendly.I highly suggest checking it out!

IXqtTdYIU_d7n9-63A7B3g.text: Great pizza and pasta place in Soho. A hidden gem. Prices are reasonable, portions are huge, and service is good. My Napolitano pizza was superb, just the right quantity of olives and anchovies. We will definitely be coming back!

cm00CuH2zfILPPnn8fy-uQ.text: Holy crap, how does this place exist?! I wanted a cheap dinner in London and found way more than I was looking for. The restaurant looks like that place you went to when you were in middle school or high school and wanted to hang out with your friends when school got out, but it's full of Londoners, foreigners, older people, and younger. The menu is great- they have about 30 pasta dishes and almost all of them are under £8. I've only had the penne amatriciana and the spaghetti bolognese but both we're delicious and for once I was glad that the portions were HUGE! I ate half at the restaurant then took half to the hotel. La Porchetta is a safe bet when you want something good, cheap, and filling, especially in Soho/Covent Garden. I'm *almost* ashamed to admit that in my four days in London, I came here twice.

photos.caption: Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom. Pasta menu

NGJtF2nR_keKsx5Vl_kcOw.text: Managed to persuade my parents to head here yesterday evening and we weren't disappointed. Pasta was great and the "Stinco porco" could've fed all of us for days.Will definitely be going back to try the pizzas....cheap and cheerful and does what its says on the tin!

8Z-oIJb4L8A_iLpk2aYl9Q.text: Pizza was good, but nothing extraordinary. Definitely good enough to eat, but not something you'll talk about tomorrow. Pasta dish was very good (Carbanara). Very rich and something I will talk about tomorrow. My friends also got lasts and throughly enjoyed. Cheers!

IW_1BbQkkD0KvnueVmoAew.text: I went with 5 people to this amazing pizza and pasta place. we have been here before and convinced our friends to eat dinner with us. staff is lovely, huge space downstairs - if you have a chance, try to sit upstairs - to watch the pizza baker :) we ordered 3 pizzas (mushroom, vegetarian and ham/mushroom), spaghetti    with meat balls and a mozzarella-tomato salad. the food was very fresh and after only 15min at the table. nobody left the place hungry :) very delicious and unbeatable prices for this area in london.

photos.caption: Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom

51ZHjZdtqPUQAB2Xtg9siw.text: It does the trick for a quick bite to eat before going to a play. But our pastas were under seasoned and they were very heavy handed with the blue cheese in my pasta. Don't think I will be rushing back there anytime soon.

4dIOJ160ciakJ3wB1NiSnQ.text: This place offers great food for the price. It isn't fancy nor does it provide amazing service but this is easily one of the cheapest and most filling meals I had in London. My whole meal consisting of a big bowl of pasta and soda was below 10 pounds. The menu is quite long with tons of pasta and pizza choices below 10 pounds. I noticed that most of the people in the restaurant ordered a pizza but I was craving pasta, so I went for that instead. I ordered the penne with amatriciana sauce and it came out perfectly. The sauce was tangy with a meaty flavor, and the pasta was tender but not overcooked. The portion was huge. I came in with quite an appetite and still left at least a quarter of the plate untouched. Service was pretty so-so but I'm sure if I had a problem, it would have been easy to get a server's attention. If you're in the area and craving a hearty, filling Italian meal that won't hit you too hard in the wallet, this is definitely worth checking out.

ahYdwzyaPCS_wASj1mH6cg.text: Going to Porchetta will make you feel you are at home.Try spaghetti bolognese or gnocchi with gorgonzola...what an amazing choice in those cold days! Price is ok and nice and friendly staff. Open until late if you fancy a good dinner after few pints :)

HwtnaJToEi4mxPzK777jPg.text: Can I just say? This place is authentic. A friend and I happened upon this joint entirely by chance! We tried asking the waitresses for help in choosing off of the menu -- they had a hard time with English but that's okay. Language barriers seem to indicate bomb food -- and this was no different. I had the penne alla amatriciana (or something like that) which was about £7 including the service charge. The portions were huuuuge for London, definitely worth two meals as I had to pack half for takeaway!! The pasta was quite flavorful and cooked to perfection, and the pizza my friend had looked amazing. Will definitely be back for great quality and great value!

photos.caption: Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom. Penne alla amatriciana!

hUqIz2kwPgIbhewDilz9Aw.text: Great food at a great price!We came here after straying from the over crowded Leicester Square - and we were not disappointed.We ate not he main floor but were told there was additional seating downstairs.  We sat near the pizza oven where diners can watch as they make your pizza.We ordered a pizza and lasagna and the portions were huge.  Great value with great flavor.

q1sQp5J6lpAOt4qRvn3K3w.text: This place is great for the value - you get a very generous portion for the price you pay. However, I thought the food was just mediocre. I ordered the "paglia e fieno ai broccoli" and when it first came out it looked/smelled super good. Unfortunately, the taste didn't quite match my expectations. The noodles were harder than I would've preferred and the broccoli seemed a bit overcooked. I'm also not sure how I felt about the chili...when I ordered I thought it was going to be a lot more subtle than it actually turned out to be (pretty spicy, in my opinion). Will I be back? Most likely not - even though the price was great, the food was a tad subpar.

photos.caption: Photo of La Porchetta Pollo Bar - London, United Kingdom. Paglia e fieno ai broccoli

SIOASW38J4ZirvWxljX4WQ.text: Went on a Saturday night, was a bit skeptical but luckily didn't have to wait too long for a table. Once seated, we ordered and the food arrived fairly quickly. The food was as good as i expected after reading a few reviews. Tried both the pasta and the pizza and it didn't disappoint. The atmosphere was amazing, and so was the interior decor, very similar to the family run restaurants you find in Italy. The best bit was the prices, every pizza and pasta dish is under £9 I believe, so can't complain. Might have to be a regular for Italian food.

vuiAXa8z393YnGL4SPqk4A.text: A favourite that we keep coming back to, delicious pasta and pizza at a great price and the service is always good.A epic range of dishes but the gnocchi sorrentino keeps calling, and the tiramsu is worth the trip itself. This is great comfort food at a bargain price, and while it may not blow you away, you will leave very happy with change in your pocket.

2bbqPRFiPyfBvbK872J44Q.text: Between the quality of food and the size of the portions, this is an absolute 5 star establishment.  La Porchetta is right in the heart of Soho and could easily charge double what they do given the location and how amazing the food is.  Nearly all the dishes are less than 10 pounds.  Although pretty busy when I visisted, there wasn't exactly a queue out the door.  The only thing I can think of is that people pass it over because it's not as posh as some of the other Italian joints in the area.  No matter, this is the place you want to eat if craving pasta or pizza.  If you're lucky enough to score a table near the pizza oven, you can watch the pizzaiolo expertly working the dough and peel.  Lending even more authenticity to this place is the fact that the staffers talk (shout) to each other in Italian.  The only downside is the small wine list.  But, for a place like this, just order a liter of the house red for the table and you're good to go.Next time you're tempted into going to Jamie's Italian (a fine place, no question; but not very authentic) come to La Porchetta instead.
